## K&K 1.2
Given two vectors $\mathbf{A} = (2\ihat - 3\jhat + 7\khat)$, $\mathbf{B} = (5\ihat + \jhat + 2\khat)$, find:

(a) $\mathbf{A} + \mathbf{B} = 7\ihat - 2\jhat + 9\khat$
(b) $\mathbf{A} - \mathbf{B} = -3\ihat - 4\jhat + 5\khat$
(c) $\mathbf{A} \cdot \mathbf{B} = 10 - 3 + 14 = 21$
(d) $\mathbf{A} \times \mathbf{B}$:
  $$
      \mathbf{A} \times \mathbf{B}
        = \begin{vmatrix}
          \ihat & \jhat & \khat\\ 2 & -3 & 7\\ 5 & 1 & 2
        \end{vmatrix}
        = \ihat(-6 - 7) - \jhat(4 - 35) + \khat(2 + 15)
        = -13\ihat + 31\jhat + 17\khat
  $$
